message.content: Help me set up a new TypeScript project with ESLint, Prettier, and Jest. I want strict type checking.

I'll help you set up a production-ready TypeScript project. Let me start by initializing the project and installing the necessary dependencies.

First, let me check if there's an existing package.json.
No existing package.json. Let me initialize a new project with all the tools you requested.
Dependencies installed. Now I'll create the configuration files with strict settings.

message.tool_input:
{"path": "tsconfig.json", "content": "{
  "compilerOptions": {
    "target": "ES2022",
    "module": "NodeNext",
    "moduleResolution": "NodeNext",
    "lib": ["ES2022"],
    "outDir": "./dist",
    "rootDir": "./src",
    "strict": true,
    "strictNullChecks": true,
    "strictFunctionTypes": true,
    "strictBindCallApply": true,
    "strictPropertyInitialization": true,
    "noImplicitAny": true,
    "noImplicitReturns": true,
    "noImplicitThis": true,
    "noUnusedLocals": true,
    "noUnusedParameters": true,
    "noFallthroughCasesInSwitch": true,
    "esModuleInterop": true,
    "skipLibCheck": true,
    "forceConsistentCasingInFileNames": true,
    "declaration": true,
    "declarationMap": true,
    "sourceMap": true
  },
  "include": ["src/**/*"],
  "exclude": ["node_modules", "dist", "**/*.test.ts"]
}"}

message.content: Now let me update the package.json with the npm scripts and create the directory structure.

message.tool_input:
{"path": "package.json", "content": "{
  "name": "new-project",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "description": "TypeScript project with strict type checking",
  "main": "dist/index.js",
  "types": "dist/index.d.ts",
  "scripts": {
    "build": "tsc",
    "dev": "ts-node src/index.ts",
    "start": "node dist/index.js",
    "test": "jest",
    "test:watch": "jest --watch",
    "test:coverage": "jest --coverage",
    "lint": "eslint src/**/*.ts",
    "lint:fix": "eslint src/**/*.ts --fix",
    "format": "prettier --write src/**/*.ts",
    "typecheck": "tsc --noEmit",
    "prepare": "npm run build"
  },
  "keywords": ["typescript"],
  "author": "",
  "license": "MIT",
  "devDependencies": {
    "@types/jest": "^29.5.0",
    "@types/node": "^20.0.0",
    "@typescript-eslint/eslint-plugin": "^6.0.0",
    "@typescript-eslint/parser": "^6.0.0",
    "eslint": "^8.0.0",
    "eslint-config-prettier": "^9.0.0",
    "eslint-plugin-prettier": "^5.0.0",
    "jest": "^29.0.0",
    "prettier": "^3.0.0",
    "ts-jest": "^29.0.0",
    "ts-node": "^10.9.0",
    "typescript": "^5.0.0"
  }
}"}

message.content: Let me verify everything works by running the commands.

message.tool_output:
> typecheck
> tsc --noEmit

✔ No type errors found

> lint
> eslint src/**/*.ts

✔ No linting errors

> test
> jest

 PASS  src/index.test.ts
  greet
    ✓ should return greeting with name (2 ms)
    ✓ should handle empty string (1 ms)

Test Suites: 1 passed, 1 total
Tests:       2 passed, 2 total

message.content:
Your TypeScript project is fully set up! Here's what was configured:

## Project Structure
```
new-project/
├── src/
│   ├── index.ts          # Main entry point
│   └── index.test.ts     # Example test
├── package.json          # Dependencies & scripts
├── tsconfig.json         # Strict TypeScript config
├── .eslintrc.json        # ESLint with TypeScript rules
├── .prettierrc           # Prettier formatting
└── jest.config.js        # Jest with ts-jest
```

## Available Scripts

| Command | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| `npm run build` | Compile TypeScript to dist/ |
| `npm run dev` | Run with ts-node (development) |
| `npm test` | Run Jest tests |
| `npm run test:watch` | Run tests in watch mode |
| `npm run test:coverage` | Run tests with coverage |
| `npm run lint` | Check for linting errors |
| `npm run lint:fix` | Auto-fix linting errors |
| `npm run format` | Format code with Prettier |
| `npm run typecheck` | Type check without emitting |

## Strict Type Checking Enabled

- `strictNullChecks` - No implicit null/undefined
- `noImplicitAny` - Must explicitly type 'any'
- `noImplicitReturns` - All code paths must return
- `noUnusedLocals` - No unused variables
- `noUnusedParameters` - No unused parameters

All checks pass. You're ready to start coding!
Awesome, thank you! This is perfect.
